00040 /* in parse_nextline.c */

00043 #define MAX_LINE_LEN 512

00045 /******** Temporary structures ********
00046  * Used to represent script commands  *
00047  **************************************/
00048 
00049 typedef struct {
00050   char *name;
00051   int linenr; /* Which line number this was defined on */
00052   int id;
00053   int nargs;
00054   char **args;
00055   
00056   int nprocess;
00057   TProcess **process; /* Processing steps */
00058 
00059   int ndep; /* Number of dependencies */
00060   char **dep; /* Dependencies */
00061   int *dep_id;
00062 
00063   /* Flags used when resolving/"compiling" script */
00064   int resolving;
00065   int calculated;
00066 }TTarget;
00067 
00068 int parse_script(FILE *script); 
00069 int resolve_script();
00070 void dummy_script(TCommands *cmd);

00072 /* Utility routines (at end of file) */
00073 int strip_space(char *string);                      /* Strip all spaces from a string */
00074 void add_dependency(TTarget *target, char *depend); /* Add a dependency to a target */
00075 int find_dependency(TTarget *targ, char *name);     /* Find a dependency in the list */
00076 int add_arg(TProcess *process);                     /* Add an argument to a processing step */
00077 int add_framearg(TProcess *process, char *name);    /* Add a frame argument */
00078 int add_floatarg(TProcess *process, char *arg);     /* Add a float argument */
00079 int add_intarg(TProcess *proces, char *arg);        /* Add an integer argument */
00080 int add_process(TCommands *cmd, int nargs); /* Add a processing step to a command list */
00081 int append_processes(TCommands *cmd, int nproc, TProcess **proc);

00084 /* List of defined targets */
00085 TTarget **target;
00086 int ntargets;

00088 /* Open a processing script */
00089 int process_script(char *exe_cmd, char *file)
00090 {
00091   FILE *fd;
00092   char buffer[256];
00093   char *str;
00094   char name[256];
00095   int found, i, n;
00096 
00097   if(file == (char*) NULL) {
00098     /* No script file specified - look for default file */
00099     strcpy(name, DEFAULT_SCRIPT);
00100   }else {
00101     strcpy(name, file);
00102   }
00103 
00104   /* Look in local directory */
00105   if((fd = fopen(name, "rt")) != (FILE*) NULL) {
00106     printf("Using processing script ./%s\n", name);
00107   }else {
00108     printf("Failed to read '%s'\n", name);
00109     
00110     /* Check for an environment variable */
00111     if((str = getenv(SCRIPT_ENV)) != (char*) NULL) {
00112       /* Environment variable set */
00113       sprintf(buffer, "%s/%s", str, name);
00114       
00115       if((fd = fopen(buffer, "rt")) != (FILE*) NULL) {
00116         printf("Using processing script %s\n", buffer);
00117       }else {
00118         printf("Failed to read '%s'\n", buffer);
00119       }
00120     }
00121   }
00122   
00123   if(fd == (FILE*) NULL) {
00124     /* Look in the executable directory */
00125     
00126     n = strlen(exe_cmd);
00127 
00128     /* Find the last '/' in the command string */
00129     found = 0;
00130     for(i=n-1;i>=0;i--) {
00131       if(exe_cmd[i] == '/') {
00132         exe_cmd[i+1] = 0;
00133         found = 1;
00134         i = 0;
00135       }
00136     }
00137     if(found) { /* Not the current directory (probably) */
00138       sprintf(buffer, "%s%s", exe_cmd, name);
00139       
00140       if((fd = fopen(buffer, "rt")) != (FILE*) NULL) {
00141         printf("Using processing script %s\n", buffer);
00142       }else {
00143         printf("Failed to read '%s'\n", buffer);
00144         printf("No processing scripts found!\n");
00145         return(1);
00146       }
00147     }else {
00148       printf("No processing scripts found!\n");
00149       return(1);
00150     }
00151   }
00152  
00153   /* Read the script */
00154   if(parse_script(fd)) {
00155     return(-1);
00156   }
00157   fclose(fd);
00158 
00159   /* Compile dependencies */
00160   if(resolve_script()) {
00161     return(-1);
00162   }
00163   printf("Script successfully compiled\n");
00164 
00165   /* Do a dummy run */
00166   dummy_script(&command);
00167 
00168   return(0);
00169 }
00170 
00171 /*********************** READ SCRIPT **************************
00172  * Read in a script file and produce a list of targets, their *
00173  * processing steps and dependencies.                         *
00174  **************************************************************/
00175 
00176 int parse_script(FILE *script)
00177 {
00178   char buffer[MAX_LINE_LEN];
00179   char *str;
00180   int linenr;
00181   int n, i, p, q;
00182   int got_output;
00183 
00184   int next_id;
00185   TTarget *curtarget, *targ;
00186   TTarget **tmptarg;
00187 
00188   TProcess *curproc;
00189   TProcess **tmpproc;
00190   
00191   int nprocargs;
00192   char **procarg;
00193   
00194   curtarget = (TTarget*) NULL;
00195   ntargets = 0;
00196   next_id = 0;
00197   got_output = 0;
00198 
00199   linenr = parse_nextline(script, buffer, MAX_LINE_LEN-1, 1);
00200   if(linenr == -1) {
00201     return(1);
00202   }
00203   do {
00204     //printf("%d: |%s|\n", linenr, buffer);
00205 
00206     n = strlen(buffer);
00207 
00208     /* Check if this is a target definition - contains a colon */
00209     p = 0;
00210     for(i=0;i<n;i++) {
00211       if(buffer[i] == ':') {
00212         /* is a target definition */
00213         p = i;
00214         i = n;
00215       }
00216     }
00217     if(p > 0) {
00218 
00219       /* Create a new target structure */
00220       
00221       tmptarg = target;
00222       target = (TTarget**) malloc(sizeof(TTarget*)*(ntargets+1));
00223       if(ntargets > 0) {
00224         for(i=0;i<ntargets;i++)
00225           target[i] = tmptarg[i];
00226         
00227         free(tmptarg);
00228       }
00229       target[ntargets] = (TTarget*) malloc(sizeof(TTarget));
00230       curtarget = target[ntargets];
00231       ntargets++;
00232 
00233       curtarget->nprocess = 0;
00234 
00235       /* Get name of target */
00236       buffer[p] = 0; /* Terminate at colon */
00237       str = &(buffer[p+1]); /* Pointer to arguments */
00238       q = strip_space(buffer); /* Strip out all spaces */
00239 
00240       /* Set name/ID */
00241       curtarget->id = next_id;  next_id++;
00242       curtarget->name = (char*) malloc(q+1);
00243       strncpy(curtarget->name, buffer, q+1);
00244       curtarget->name[q] = 0; /* Make sure it's null-terminated */
00245       
00246       curtarget->linenr = linenr;
00247 
00248       /* Check if name is pre-defined */
00249 
00250       if(strcmp(buffer, "OUTPUT") == 0) {
00251         /* This is the output frame */
00252         if(got_output) {
00253           /* output already defined */
00254           printf("Error line %d: Output target already defined on line %d!\n", linenr, got_output);
00255           return(1);
00256         }
00257         curtarget->id = OUTPUT_FRAME;
00258         next_id--; /* Don't need to use this ID */
00259         got_output = linenr;
00260 
00261         /* Move output target to target[0] */
00262         targ = target[0];
00263         target[0] = target[ntargets-1];
00264         target[ntargets-1] = targ;
00265 
00266       }else if( (strcmp(buffer, "MINIMUM") == 0) || 
00267                 (strcmp(buffer, "AVERAGE") == 0) ||
00268                 (strcmp(buffer, "INPUT") == 0) ) {
00269         /* These are reserved frame names - cannot have a target called this */
00270         printf("Error line %d: Cannot use %s as a target - it is a predefined frame\n", linenr, buffer);
00271         return(1);
00272       }else {
00273         /* Check if there is already a target called this */
00274         for(i=0;i<(ntargets-1);i++) {
00275           if(strcmp(buffer, target[i]->name) == 0) {
00276             printf("Error line %d: Target %s already defined on line %d\n", 
00277                    linenr, buffer, target[i]->linenr);
00278             return(1);
00279           }
00280         }
00281       }
00282       
00283       /* Get input frames from str */
00284       q = strip_space(str); /* Strip all spaces. frames separated by commas */
00285       if(q == 0) {
00286         /* No input frames */
00287         printf("Error line %d: No input for target %s\n", linenr, buffer);
00288         return(1);
00289       }
00290       /* Count number of commas */
00291       p = 1;
00292       for(i=0;i<q;i++) {
00293         if(str[i] == ',')
00294           p++;
00295       }
00296       //printf("Target %s has %d inputs:", buffer, p);
00297       /* Allocate array of strings */
00298       curtarget->nargs = p;
00299       curtarget->args = (char**) malloc(sizeof(char*)*p);
00300       curtarget->args[0] = (char*) malloc(q+1);
00301       strcpy(curtarget->args[0], str);
00302       p = 1;
00303       for(i=0;i<q;i++) {
00304         if(str[i] == ',') {
00305           /* End of one string, beginning of another */
00306           curtarget->args[0][i] = 0;
00307           curtarget->args[p] = &(curtarget->args[0][i+1]);
00308           p++;
00309         }
00310       }
00311 
00312       /* Check the arguments */
00313       for(i=0;i<curtarget->nargs;i++) {
00314         /* Check length */
00315         if(strlen(curtarget->args[i]) == 0) {
00316           printf("Error line %d: Target %s has a zero-length input (extra comma?)\n", linenr, buffer);
00317           return(1);
00318         }
00319         //printf("|%s| ", curtarget->args[i]);
00320       }
00321       //printf("\n");
00322 
00323       /* Copy the arguments into the dependency list */
00324       curtarget->dep = (char**) malloc(sizeof(char*)*curtarget->nargs);
00325       for(i=0;i<curtarget->nargs;i++) {
00326         curtarget->dep[i] = curtarget->args[i];
00327       }
00328       curtarget->ndep = curtarget->nargs;
00329 
00330     }else if(strncmp(buffer, "INCLUDE ", 8) == 0) { 
00331       /* Include a file */
00332 
00333       printf("Sorry line %d: Eventually you will be able to include other scripts (maybe)\n", linenr);
00334       return(1);
00335     }else {
00336       /* Not a target or include - must be a processing step */
00337       if(curtarget == (TTarget*) NULL) { /* No current target */
00338         printf("Error line %d: No target specified here\n", linenr);
00339         return(1);
00340       }
00341       /* Separate the command from the arguments */
00342       for(i=0;i<n;i++) {
00343         if(buffer[i] == ' ') {
00344           buffer[i] = 0;
00345           str = &(buffer[i+1]);
00346           i = n;
00347         }else if(buffer[i] == 0) {
00348           /* No arguments */
00349           str = &(buffer[i]);
00350           i = n;
00351         }
00352       }
00353       /* buffer now contains command, str contains arguments */
00354       
00355       /* Add a processing step to the current target */
00356       tmpproc = curtarget->process;
00357       curtarget->process = (TProcess**) malloc(sizeof(TProcess*)*(curtarget->nprocess + 1));
00358       if(curtarget->nprocess > 0) {
00359         for(i=0;i<curtarget->nprocess;i++)
00360           curtarget->process[i] = tmpproc[i];
00361         free(tmpproc);
00362       }
00363       curtarget->process[curtarget->nprocess] = (TProcess*) malloc(sizeof(TProcess));
00364       curproc = curtarget->process[curtarget->nprocess];
00365       curtarget->nprocess++;
00366 
00367       /* Process arguments */
00368       
00369       nprocargs = 0;
00370       q = 0;
00371       for(i=0;i<strlen(str);i++) {
00372         if(isspace(str[i]) == 0) {
00373           /* Not a space */
00374           if(q == 0) {
00375             q = 1;
00376             nprocargs++;
00377           }
00378         }else {
00379           q = 0;
00380         }
00381       }
00382       //printf("%d args: ", nprocargs);
00383       if(nprocargs > 0) {
00384         /* Separate into separate strings */
00385         procarg = (char**) malloc(sizeof(char*)*nprocargs);
00386         procarg[0] = (char*) malloc(strlen(str)+1);
00387         strcpy(procarg[0], str);
00388         p = 1;
00389         q = 0;
00390         for(i=0;i<strlen(str);i++) {
00391           if(isspace(str[i]) == 0) {
00392             /* Not a space */
00393             if(q == 0) {
00394               q = 1;
00395               procarg[p] = &(procarg[0][i]);
00396             }
00397           }else {
00398             q = 0;
00399             procarg[0][i] = 0;
00400           }
00401         }
00402         /*
00403         for(i=0;i<nprocargs;i++) {
00404           printf("|%s| ", procarg[i]);
00405         }
00406         */
00407       }
00408       //printf("\n");
00409       curproc->nargs = 0;
00410       
00411       /* Test what the command is */
00412       
00413       if(strcmp(buffer, "SUBTRACT") == 0) {
00414         /* Expect a single argument - should be a frame */
00415         curproc->method = PROC_SUBTRACT;
00416         if(nprocargs != 1) {
00417           printf("Error line %d: Subtract has one argument\n", linenr);
00418           return(1);
00419         }
00420         /* Argument is the name of a frame - copy into argument */
00421         add_framearg(curproc, procarg[0]);
00422         /* Add to dependency list */
00423         add_dependency(curtarget, procarg[0]);
00424         
00425       }else if(strcmp(buffer, "NORMALIZE") == 0) {
00426         curproc->method = PROC_NORMALIZE;
00427         if(nprocargs != 0) {
00428           printf("Error line %d: Normalize has no arguments\n", linenr);
00429           return(1);
00430         }
00431         
00432       }else if(strcmp(buffer, "AMPLIFY") == 0) {
00433         curproc->method = PROC_AMPLIFY;
00434         /* Should have one floating-point argument */
00435         if(nprocargs != 1) {
00436           printf("Error line %d: Amplify has one argument\n", linenr);
00437           return(1);
00438         }
00439         if(add_floatarg(curproc, procarg[0])) {
00440           printf("Error line %d: Argument to amplify is a floating point number\n", linenr);
00441           return(1);
00442         }
00443       }else if(strcmp(buffer, "GAMMA") == 0) {
00444         curproc->method = PROC_GAMMA;
00445         if(nprocargs != 1) {
00446           printf("Error line %d: Gamma has one argument\n", linenr);
00447           return(1);
00448         }
00449         if(add_floatarg(curproc, procarg[0])) {
00450           printf("Error line %d: Argument to gamma is a floating point number\n", linenr);
00451           return(1);
00452         }
00453       }else if(strcmp(buffer, "OFFSET") == 0) {
00454         curproc->method = PROC_OFFSET;
00455         if(nprocargs != 1) {
00456           printf("Error line %d: Offset has one argument\n", linenr);
00457           return(1);
00458         }
00459         if(add_floatarg(curproc, procarg[0])) {
00460           printf("Error line %d: Argument to offset is a floating point number\n", linenr);
00461           return(1);
00462         }
00463       }else if(strcmp(buffer, "DESPECKLE_MEDIAN") == 0) {
00464         curproc->method = PROC_DESPECKLE_MEDIAN;
00465         if(nprocargs != 1) {
00466           printf("Error line %d: Despeckle_median has one argument\n", linenr);
00467           return(1);
00468         }
00469         if(add_intarg(curproc, procarg[0])) {
00470           printf("Error line %d: Argument to despeckle_median is an integer\n", linenr);
00471           return(1);
00472         }
00473       }else if(strcmp(buffer, "KUWAHARA") == 0) {
00474         curproc->method = PROC_KUWAHARA;
00475         if(nprocargs != 1) {
00476           printf("Error line %d: Kuwahara has one argument\n", linenr);
00477           return(1);
00478         }
00479         if(add_intarg(curproc, procarg[0])) {
00480           printf("Error line %d: Argument to kuwahara is an integer\n", linenr);
00481           return(1);
00482         }
00483       }else if(strcmp(buffer, "SHARPEN") == 0) {
00484         curproc->method = PROC_SHARPEN;
00485         if(nprocargs != 1) {
00486           printf("Error line %d: Sharpen has one argument\n", linenr);
00487           return(1);
00488         }
00489         if(add_floatarg(curproc, procarg[0])) {
00490           printf("Error line %d: Argument to sharpen is a floating point number\n", linenr);
00491           return(1);
00492         }
00493           
00494       }else if(strcmp(buffer, "UNSHARP_MASK") == 0) {
00495         curproc->method = PROC_UNSHARP_MASK;
00496         if(nprocargs != 2) {
00497           printf("Error line %d: Unsharp_mask has 2 arguments\n", linenr);
00498           return(1);
00499         }
00500         if(add_floatarg(curproc, procarg[0])) {
00501           printf("Error line %d: First argument to unsharp_mask is a floating point number\n", linenr);
00502           return(1);
00503         }
00504         if(add_floatarg(curproc, procarg[1])) {
00505           printf("Error line %d: Second argument to unsharp_mask is a floating point number\n", linenr);
00506           return(1);
00507         }
00508       }else if(strcmp(buffer, "GAUSS_BLUR") == 0) {
00509         curproc->method = PROC_GAUSSBLUR;
00510         if(nprocargs != 1) {
00511           printf("Error line %d: Gauss_blur takes one argument\n", linenr);
00512         }
00513         if(add_floatarg(curproc, procarg[0])) {
00514           printf("Error line %d: Argument to gauss_blur is floating point number (sigma)\n", linenr);
00515           return(1);
00516         }
00517       }else {
00518         printf("Error line %d: Unknown processing command %s in target %s\n", linenr, buffer, curtarget->name);
00519         return(1);
00520       }
00521 
00522 
00523     }/* End of process */   
00524     
00525   }while((linenr = parse_nextline(script, buffer, MAX_LINE_LEN-1, 0)) != -1);
00526 
00527   return(0);
00528 }
00529 
00530 /*********************** RESOLVE SCRIPT ***********************
00531  * Takes a list of targets and produces a sequential set of   *
00532  * processing steps, resolving dependencies.                  *
00533  **************************************************************/
00534 
00535 int resolve_script_rec(char *name);
00536 
00537 int resolve_script()
00538 {
00539   int i, j;
00540   int n;
00541 
00542   /* Clear flags in targets */
00543   for(i=0;i<ntargets;i++) {
00544     target[i]->resolving = 0;   /* 1 if currently being resolved (prevent loops) */
00545     target[i]->calculated = UNKNOWN_FRAME; /* The ID of the frame for this target */
00546   }
00547   
00548   command.ntemp = 0;      /* No intermediate frames */
00549   command.minimum_frame = UNKNOWN_FRAME; /* No minimum frame */
00550   command.average_frame = UNKNOWN_FRAME; /* No average frame */
00551   command.nsteps = 0;     /* No processing steps */
00552   
00553   n = resolve_script_rec("OUTPUT"); /* Resolve the output target */
00554   
00555   if((n != command.ntemp-1) || (n == UNKNOWN_FRAME)) { /* If worked properly, output should be last frame allocated */
00556     printf("Could not compile script\n");
00557     return(-1);
00558   }
00559   /* Need to replace last frame with output in all commands */
00560   for(i=0;i<command.nsteps;i++) {
00561     if(command.step[i].input == n)
00562       command.step[i].input = OUTPUT_FRAME;
00563     if(command.step[i].result == n)
00564       command.step[i].result = OUTPUT_FRAME;
00565     /* Go through arguments */
00566     for(j=0;j<command.step[i].nargs;j++) {
00567       if(command.step[i].args[j].frame == n) {
00568         command.step[i].args[j].frame = OUTPUT_FRAME;
00569       }
00570     }
00571   }
00572   command.ntemp--; /* Don't need last intermediate frame */
00573   return(0);
00574 }
00575 
00576 /* Recursive code to resolve dependencies. 
00577    Passed the name of a frame, returns ID */
00578 int resolve_script_rec(char *name)
00579 {
00580   int i, j, p, q;
00581   TTarget *curtarget;
00582   TProcess *curproc;
00583   int next_input; /* ID of the input to the next stage */
00584 
00585   //printf("Resolving %s\n", name);
00586 
00587   /* Check for pre-defined frames */
00588   if(strcmp(name, "INPUT") == 0) {
00589     /* Just the input frame */
00590     return(INPUT_FRAME);
00591   }else if(strcmp(name, "MINIMUM") == 0) {
00592     if(command.minimum_frame == UNKNOWN_FRAME) {
00593       /* Calculate minimum and put into temporary frame */
00594       command.minimum_frame = command.ntemp;
00595       command.ntemp++;
00596       //printf("Assigning minimum frame to %d\n", command.minimum_frame);
00597     }
00598     
00599     return(command.minimum_frame);
00600   }else if(strcmp(name, "AVERAGE") == 0) {
00601     if(command.average_frame == UNKNOWN_FRAME) {
00602       /* Calculate average and put into temporary frame */
00603       command.average_frame = command.ntemp;
00604       command.ntemp++;
00605     }
00606     return(command.average_frame);
00607   }
00608   
00609   /* Find the name in the list of targets */
00610   p = -1;
00611   for(i=0;i<ntargets;i++) {
00612     if(strcmp(target[i]->name, name) == 0) {
00613       /* Found target */
00614       p = i;
00615       i = ntargets;
00616     }
00617   }
00618   
00619   if(p == -1) {
00620     /* Target not found */
00621     printf("Error: Frame %s is not defined\n", name);
00622     return(UNKNOWN_FRAME);
00623   }
00624 
00625   curtarget = target[p];
00626 
00627   if(curtarget->resolving) {
00628     /* This target is currently being resolved => Circular dependency */
00629     printf("Error: target %s (line %d) has a circular dependency\n", name, curtarget->linenr);
00630     return(UNKNOWN_FRAME);
00631   }
00632 
00633   if(curtarget->calculated == UNKNOWN_FRAME) {
00634     /* frame not calculated yet */
00635     //printf("Frame %s not calculated yet\n", curtarget->name);
00636     /**************** Resolve dependencies **************/
00637     
00638     curtarget->resolving = 1; /* Currently resolving */
00639     curtarget->dep_id = (int*) malloc(sizeof(int)*curtarget->ndep);
00640     for(i=0;i<curtarget->ndep;i++) {
00641       curtarget->dep_id[i] = resolve_script_rec(curtarget->dep[i]);
00642       if(curtarget->dep_id[i] == UNKNOWN_FRAME) {
00643         /* Could not resolve */
00644         printf("=> Could not resolve target %s (line %d)\n", name, curtarget->linenr);
00645         return(UNKNOWN_FRAME);
00646       }
00647     }
00648     curtarget->resolving = 0; /* Done resolving */
00649 
00650     /*********** Produce list of processing commands ***********/
00651     
00652     /* Grab a frame number for the result */
00653     curtarget->calculated = command.ntemp;
00654     command.ntemp++;
00655     //printf("Assigning %s to frame %d\n", curtarget->name, curtarget->calculated);
00656 
00657     /* Initial command - could be concatenate */
00658     if(curtarget->nargs > 1) {
00659       /* More than one argument - have to concatenate */
00660       p = add_process(&command, curtarget->nargs);
00661       curproc = &(command.step[p]);
00662       
00663       curproc->method = PROC_CONCATENATE;
00664       curproc->input = UNKNOWN_FRAME; /* Leave blank - all args are inputs */
00665       curproc->result = curtarget->calculated; /* Output frame */
00666       for(i=0;i<curtarget->nargs;i++) {
00667         /* Set the input frames */
00668         curproc->args[i].frame = find_dependency(curtarget, curtarget->args[i]);
00669         if(curproc->args[i].frame == UNKNOWN_FRAME)
00670           return(UNKNOWN_FRAME);
00671       }
00672       next_input = curtarget->calculated;
00673     }else if(curtarget->nprocess == 0) {
00674       /* No processing steps - copy input to output (not very useful, but hey) */
00675       p = add_process(&command, 0);
00676       curproc = &(command.step[p]);
00677       
00678       curproc->method = PROC_COPY;
00679       /* Set the input frame */
00680       curproc->input = find_dependency(curtarget, curtarget->args[0]);
00681       /* Set output frame */
00682       curproc->result = curtarget->calculated;
00683       next_input = curtarget->calculated;
00684     }else {
00685       /* Just the one input being processed */
00686       next_input = find_dependency(curtarget, curtarget->args[0]); /* Read the input */
00687     }
00688     
00689     /* Append the processing steps onto end of list. Returns index of first one added */
00690     q = append_processes(&command, curtarget->nprocess, curtarget->process);
00691 
00692     /* Go through the new commands */
00693     for(i=q;i<(curtarget->nprocess+q);i++) {
00694       curproc = &(command.step[i]);
00695 
00696       /* Set input and output */
00697       curproc->input = next_input;
00698       curproc->result = curtarget->calculated;
00699 
00700       /* Need to resolve arguments which are frames */
00701       if(curproc->method == PROC_SUBTRACT) {
00702         /* One argument - a frame */
00703         curproc->args[0].frame = find_dependency(curtarget, curproc->args[0].name);
00704       }
00705       
00706       /* Some processing cannot have the same input as output - check array */
00707       if(proc_noio[0] != PROC_NULL) { /* If there are any such commands */
00708         j = 0;
00709         do {
00710           if(curproc->method == proc_noio[j]) {
00711             /* This processing step is one of these
00712              * Check that the input and output are different */
00713             if(curproc->input == curproc->result) {
00714               /* Grab a new frame number */
00715               curproc->result = command.ntemp;
00716               command.ntemp++;
00717               curtarget->calculated = curproc->result; /* Change the target frame */
00718               //printf("Changed %s to frame %d\n", curtarget->name, curtarget->calculated);
00719             }
00720             j = -1;
00721           }
00722         }while((proc_noio[j+1] != PROC_NULL) && (j > 0));
00723       }
00724 
00725       next_input = curproc->result; /* Set the next input to be the result of this step */
00726 
00727       /* Finished this processing step */
00728     }
00729     /* Finished compiling target */
00730     return(curtarget->calculated);
00731   }else {
00732     /* frame already calculated */
00733     //printf("Target %s calculated in %d\n", curtarget->name, curtarget->calculated);
00734     return(curtarget->calculated);
00735   }
00736   return(UNKNOWN_FRAME); /* Should never reach here */
00737 }
00738 
00739 /********************** DUMMY-RUN SCRIPT **********************
00740  * Goes through the command list printing out steps           *
00741  **************************************************************/
00742 
00743 void targ_str(int id)
00744 {
00745   if(id == UNKNOWN_FRAME) {
00746     printf("UNKNOWN");
00747   }else if(id == OUTPUT_FRAME) {
00748     printf("OUTPUT");
00749   }else if(id == INPUT_FRAME) {
00750     printf("INPUT");
00751   }else {
00752     printf("<%d>", id);
00753   }
00754 }
00755 
00756 void dummy_script(TCommands *cmd)
00757 {
00758   int i, j;
00759   TProcess *proc;
00760   printf("\n======== SCRIPT OPERATIONS =========\n");
00761   printf("Number of intermediate frames: %d\n", cmd->ntemp);
00762   /* Calculate background frames */
00763   if(cmd->minimum_frame != UNKNOWN_FRAME) {
00764     printf("Calculate minimum => ");
00765     targ_str(cmd->minimum_frame);
00766     printf("\n");
00767   }
00768   if(cmd->average_frame != UNKNOWN_FRAME) {
00769     printf("Calculate average => ");
00770     targ_str(cmd->average_frame);
00771     printf("\n");
00772   }
00773   /* Go through commands */
00774   for(i=0;i<cmd->nsteps;i++) {
00775     proc = &(cmd->step[i]);
00776     switch(proc->method) {
00777     case PROC_SUBTRACT: {
00778       targ_str(proc->input);
00779       printf(" - ");
00780       targ_str(proc->args[0].frame);
00781       printf(" => ");
00782       targ_str(proc->result);
00783       break;
00784     }
00785     case PROC_NORMALIZE: {
00786       printf("Normalize(");
00787       targ_str(proc->input);
00788       printf(") => ");
00789       targ_str(proc->result);
00790       break;
00791     }
00792     case PROC_AMPLIFY: {
00793       targ_str(proc->input);
00794       printf(" * %f => ", proc->args[0].fval);
00795       targ_str(proc->result);
00796       break;
00797     }
00798     case PROC_GAMMA: {
00799       printf("Gamma(");
00800       targ_str(proc->input);
00801       printf(", %f) => ", proc->args[0].fval);
00802       targ_str(proc->result);
00803       break;
00804     }
00805     case PROC_OFFSET: {
00806       targ_str(proc->input);
00807       printf(" + %f => ", proc->args[0].fval);
00808       targ_str(proc->result);
00809       break;
00810     }
00811     case PROC_DESPECKLE_MEDIAN: {
00812       printf("Despeckle(");
00813       targ_str(proc->input);
00814       printf(", %d) => ", proc->args[0].ival);
00815       targ_str(proc->result);
00816       break;
00817     } 
00818     case PROC_KUWAHARA: {
00819       printf("Kuwahara(");
00820       targ_str(proc->input);
00821       printf(", %d) => ", proc->args[0].ival);
00822       targ_str(proc->result);
00823       break;
00824     }
00825     case PROC_SHARPEN: {
00826       printf("Sharpen(");
00827       targ_str(proc->input);
00828       printf(", %f) => ", proc->args[0].fval);
00829       targ_str(proc->result);
00830       break;
00831     }
00832     case PROC_UNSHARP_MASK: {
00833       printf("Unsharp_mask(");
00834       targ_str(proc->input);
00835       printf(", %f, %f) => ", proc->args[0].fval, proc->args[1].fval);
00836       targ_str(proc->result);
00837       break;
00838     }
00839     case PROC_CONCATENATE: {
00840       printf("Concatenate(");
00841       for(j=0;j<proc->nargs;j++) {
00842         targ_str(proc->args[j].frame);
00843         if(j != (proc->nargs-1)) {
00844           printf(", ");
00845         }
00846       }
00847       printf(") => ");
00848       targ_str(proc->result);
00849       break;
00850     }
00851     case PROC_COPY: {
00852       printf("Copy ");
00853       targ_str(proc->input);
00854       printf(" => ");
00855       targ_str(proc->result);
00856       break;
00857     }
00858     case PROC_GAUSSBLUR: {
00859       printf("Gaussian blur(");
00860       targ_str(proc->input);
00861       printf(", %f) => ", proc->args[0].fval);
00862       targ_str(proc->result);
00863       break;
00864     }
00865     default: {
00866       printf("Error! Unrecognised command %d", cmd->step[i].method);
00867     }
00868     }
00869     
00870     printf("\n");
00871   }
00872   printf("===================================\n");
00873 }
00874 
00875 /*********************** UTILITY ROUTINES *********************/
00876 
00877 /* Strips all spaces from the string */
00878 int strip_space(char *string)
00879 {
00880   int i, n, p;
00881 
00882   n = strlen(string);
00883 
00884   p = 0;
00885   for(i=0;i<n;i++) {
00886     if(isspace(string[i]) == 0) {
00887       /* Not a space */
00888       string[p] = string[i];
00889       p++;
00890     }
00891   }
00892   string[p] = 0; /* New termination */
00893 
00894   return(p);
00895 }
00896 
00897 /* Add a dependency to a target */
00898 void add_dependency(TTarget *targ, char *depend)
00899 {
00900   char **tmp;
00901   int i;
00902 
00903   /* Check if the dependency is already in the list */
00904   for(i=0;i<targ->ndep;i++) {
00905     if(strcmp(targ->dep[i], depend) == 0) {
00906       /* Already in list */
00907       return;
00908     }
00909   }
00910 
00911   tmp = targ->dep;
00912 
00913   targ->dep = (char**) malloc(sizeof(char*)*(targ->ndep+1));
00914   if(targ->ndep > 0) {
00915     for(i=0;i<targ->ndep;i++) {
00916       targ->dep[i] = tmp[i];
00917     }
00918     free(tmp);
00919   }
00920   targ->dep[targ->ndep] = depend;
00921   targ->ndep++;
00922 }
00923 
00924 int find_dependency(TTarget *targ, char *name)
00925 {
00926   int n, i;
00927 
00928   n = UNKNOWN_FRAME;
00929   for(i=0;i<targ->ndep;i++) {
00930     if(strcmp(targ->dep[i], name) == 0) {
00931       n = i;
00932     }
00933   }
00934   if(n != UNKNOWN_FRAME)
00935     n = targ->dep_id[n];
00936   return(n);
00937 }
00938 
00939 /* Adds an argument to a processing step */
00940 int add_arg(TProcess *process)
00941 {
00942   TProcArg *tmp;
00943   
00944   tmp = process->args;
00945   process->args = (TProcArg*) malloc(sizeof(TProcArg)*(process->nargs+1));
00946   if(process->nargs > 0) {
00947     /* Copy over the data */
00948     memcpy(process->args, tmp, sizeof(TProcArg)*process->nargs);
00949     /* Free the old array */
00950     free(tmp);
00951   }
00952   process->nargs++;
00953   return(process->nargs-1);
00954 }
00955 
00956 /* Add a frame argument to a processing step */
00957 int add_framearg(TProcess *process, char *name)
00958 {
00959   int n, p;
00960 
00961   n = strlen(name);
00962   if(n < 1) {
00963     return(1);
00964   }
00965 
00966   p = add_arg(process);
00967   process->args[p].name = (char*) malloc(sizeof(char)*(n+1));
00968   strcpy(process->args[p].name, name);
00969   process->args[p].frame = UNKNOWN_FRAME;
00970 
00971   return(0);
00972 }
00973 
00974 int add_floatarg(TProcess *process, char *arg)
00975 {
00976   float val;
00977   int p;
00978   
00979   if(sscanf(arg, "%f", &val) != 1) {
00980     return(1);
00981   }
00982   
00983   p = add_arg(process);
00984   process->args[p].fval = val;
00985   
00986   return(0);
00987 }
00988 
00989 /* Add an integer argument to a processing step */
00990 int add_intarg(TProcess *process, char *arg)
00991 {
00992   int val;
00993   int p;
00994   
00995   if(sscanf(arg, "%d", &val) != 1) {
00996     return(1);
00997   }
00998   
00999   p = add_arg(process);
01000   process->args[p].ival = val;
01001   
01002   return(0);
01003 }
01004 
01005 /* Add a processing step to a command list */
01006 int add_process(TCommands *cmd, int nargs)
01007 {
01008   TProcess *tmp;
01009   int i, n;
01010 
01011   tmp = cmd->step;
01012   cmd->step = (TProcess*) malloc(sizeof(TProcess)*(cmd->nsteps+1));
01013   if(cmd->nsteps > 0) {
01014     memcpy(cmd->step, tmp, sizeof(TProcess)*cmd->nsteps);
01015     free(tmp);
01016   }
01017   
01018   n = cmd->nsteps;
01019   cmd->nsteps++;
01020 
01021   cmd->step[n].method = PROC_NULL; /* No operation */
01022   cmd->step[n].nargs = nargs;
01023   if(nargs > 0) {
01024     /* Allocate memory */
01025     cmd->step[n].args = (TProcArg*) malloc(sizeof(TProcArg)*nargs);
01026     for(i=0;i<nargs;i++) {
01027       cmd->step[n].args[i].name = (char*) NULL;
01028       cmd->step[n].args[i].frame = UNKNOWN_FRAME;
01029     }
01030   }
01031   return(n);
01032 }
01033 
01034 /* Append a set of processes onto the end of the list */
01035 int append_processes(TCommands *cmd, int nproc, TProcess **proc)
01036 {
01037   TProcess *tmp;
01038   int i, n;
01039   
01040   tmp = cmd->step;
01041   cmd->step = (TProcess*) malloc(sizeof(TProcess)*(nproc+cmd->nsteps));
01042   if(cmd->nsteps > 0) {
01043     /* Copy current processing steps */
01044     memcpy(cmd->step, tmp, sizeof(TProcess)*cmd->nsteps);
01045     /* Free old data */
01046     free(tmp);
01047   }
01048   /* Append new processing steps */
01049   for(i=0;i<nproc;i++) {
01050     memcpy(&(cmd->step[cmd->nsteps+i]), proc[i], sizeof(TProcess));
01051   }
01052   n = cmd->nsteps;
01053   cmd->nsteps += nproc;
01054   return(n);
01055 }
